extendedInfo.description: Now you can search thousands of tech jobs right from your Android device.The Dice.com Android app allows you to instantly search and apply for technology jobs from the employers you want to work for-anytime, anywhere. This app is from Dice, the leader in tech careers, which means when search by keyword and/or location, youâll find only tech jobs. Period.The Dice Job Search app gives you the edge you need to find and apply for the right tech job, fast. Use your existing resume and cover letter from your Dice.com account or upload and manage a new profile right from the app.   You can even setup and manage job alerts, save jobs and email them to a friend.The Dice.com Job Search app gives you convenient access to a wide variety of tech job postings like software engineer, systems administrator, DBA, project manager and thousands more. You can read articles from the Dice Blog Network and stay on top of the latest trends and connect with other tech pros in the community forum.Your time is valuable, make the most of it by using the mobile app designed for tech pros like you.  Download the app to start searching and applying for technology jobs now.-  Search thousands of technology jobs by location and keyword -  Use your existing resume and cover letter on Dice.com and apply for technology jobs on-the-go-	Email jobs right from the app-	Read the latest articles from the Dice Blog Network

reviews.title: Is a mediocre app
reviews.comment: It sucks having to log in every time. Why don\'t you have a remember me feature? Also clicking to expand job descriptions only works about 25% of the time. Usually you just get sent to the top of the page and all of the text in the job description gets wiped out.
reviews.author: Kim Dorris

reviews.title: Does what its supposed too.
reviews.comment: I have a GS3 and using this I can literally apply for jobs from almost anywhere. Manage and edit my resume and cover letter on the go is flawless. Actually got a few interviews using this app. To hell what everyone else says, try for yourself. I did and couldn\'t be more satisfied
reviews.author: Byron White

reviews.title: Poor imitation of the web version
reviews.comment: A good, generic mobile app is hard to find. And this one definitely does not fit the bill
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Lazy
reviews.comment: Nice port of the mobile site; horrible mobile app. Any android dev worth their computer could probably do better in a weekend.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Crashes
reviews.comment: For a site that is trying to lure the tech savvy, this app makes them look quite silly... How bout posting a job on your own website to fix this piece of crap.  Like the idea though.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: This is an IT search app?
reviews.comment: The simple fact that I have to log in to this app every time I open it... worthless! Scared to even apply to a job from this in fear it won\'t work correctly. Guess I\'ll keep to just saving it to apply from my pc later.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Marks

reviews.title: Cant run saved searches
reviews.comment: Every time I try to run a saved search it makes me log in again.,  then still won\'t run the search.  What a waste
reviews.author: Diana Botelho

reviews.title: Doesn\'t show jobs properly, repeated login
reviews.comment: This app is only useful in seeing jobs out there and just e-mailing to you.  It repeatedly asks for login details instead of storing the info, and the job links to apply are not always accessible.  Running the search agent requires a login for some reason.  This app needs strong improvement for it to even be considered 3 stars.
reviews.author: Govind Ramabadran

reviews.title: Why do I have to log in every time?
reviews.comment: My only problem with this app is a big one, hence the low rating. There should be no reason I have to log into the app every time I want to use it. Make it remember me or at least remember my username and we\'ll be good.
reviews.author: Chris R.

reviews.title: Buggy, Poor Design
reviews.comment: I would have expected a lot more from a tech job search site. App is not only buggy but basically is a poor frontend for the website. Needs serious updating, but until then, stick with the mobile site.
reviews.author: Anthony Giacalone

reviews.title: Slight improvement over web, missing features
reviews.comment: Features are missing vs the website, and some features (like search agent editing) have ambiguous interfaces. Needs a lot of work.
reviews.author: Eric Scoles

reviews.title: Useless
reviews.comment: Job search is terrible
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Eh
reviews.comment: Not as bad as people are saying, it is still useable. But with that being said- comon devs, this is an IT recruiting site. You guys should be embarassed.
reviews.author: Saurabh N

reviews.title: Tech Un-support
reviews.comment: Completed profile and uploaded resume and I received emails from Dice with job opportunities that did not match any of my skills. No response to email inquiries either. Waste of time.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Just a dumbed down web browser
reviews.comment: All it does is display the mobile dice website. luckily the mobile site is pretty decent, but I\'d rather stick with Opera to display it.
reviews.author: Scott Sweeten

reviews.title: Not impressed
reviews.comment: This app always crashes when I try to open \"my dice\" from the home job search screen.  (Galaxy S2)
reviews.author: Emily Hartman

reviews.title: Terrible.
reviews.comment: Why does it \"correct\" my key words? I put in what I wanted and changed them.  Certainly not for tech people.
reviews.author: Mark Pace

reviews.title: Poorly designed
reviews.comment: Many issues that affect user experience: Cannot expand descriptions Using the back key brings up the refine search options The website is the way to go
reviews.author: Andrew Durfee

reviews.title: Was great butt
reviews.comment: Keeps crashing whenever I try to go settings our my dice tab
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I tried
reviews.comment: I tried to like it even given all the one star ratings.  Crashed within 5 minutes of using it.  Please fix this app.  It could be great if fixed
reviews.author: matt coston
